title: Improved rates for derivative free play in convex games
abstract: The influential work of Bravo et al. (2018) shows that derivative free play in strongly monotone games has complexity O(d/ε), where ε is the target accuracy on the expected squared distance to the solution. This note shows that the efficiency estimate is actually O(d/ε), which reduces to the known efficiency guarantee for the method in unconstrained optimization. The argument we present is elementary, simply interpreting the method as stochastic gradient play on a slightly perturbed strongly monotone game.
